keynotes: Spleenic alertness to past patterns (44) → Ego’s power to transmit/sell (26).
Tribal: remembers what worked, repackages it, and offers it back.
Deals in trust, reputation, and correct promises.
Must only promise what the Heart (26) can actually deliver.
Shadow: manipulation, overpromising, using memory to control.
Healthy: efficient, practical, persuasive tribal marketing.
Bridge between instinctive past (44) and present need (tribe).
Key part of the Ego/Will education field in Human Design.
notes:
The 44–26 is the classic **Channel of Surrender** in the Tribal Ego/Spleen circuitry. **Gate 44** in the Spleen is *Coming to Meet* — it recognizes patterns, smells, and people from the past, and it knows what the tribe has already seen. **Gate 26** in the Ego/Heart is *The Egoist* — the will to package, promote, and remember only what truly serves. Together they form the ‘sales’ or ‘transmission’ channel of the tribe: *I know what works (44) and I can get it across (26).* 

At its highest, this channel is impeccably honest: it only sells what is correct for the tribe, it only promises what the Heart can keep, and it preserves the tribal record. At its lowest, it becomes slick: exaggeration, selective memory, or using pattern-recognition to push people.

Because it’s tribal, it’s relational — credibility matters. When 26 has rested (remember: Ego is a small motor), this channel can teach, sell, and persuade brilliantly; when the Ego is tired, promises will break.
